authors: Department of Psychology, University of Cape Town, Rondebosch, South Africa.
text: This is a brief overview of my "neuropsychoanalytic" perspective on the unconscious. It should make clear how much psychoanalysis has to gain from incorporating the findings of neuroscientific disciplines studying the same part of nature-the workings of the human mind. I hope it makes equally clear what useful new perspectives can be cast on current issues in cognitive neuroscience, if they, in turn, incorporate the findings of psychoanalysis.
title: What is "the unconscious," and where is it located in the brain? A neuropsychoanalytic perspective.
journal: Annals of the New York Academy of Sciences
